job_title: Speech Language Pathologist in Washington, DC
pros:

pros: Good pay. I mean they pay well but you’re going to pay FOR it too.
cons:
Terrible management, lots of $$ goes to Foundation but little to actual hospital where sick and dying kids are. 

You’ll be fired for giving any professional advice about the awful state of things. HR is downright evil and simply props up Management and keeps the state of things continuing. Corruption abounds. I spoke to many crying employees — in tears over the absolute debacle regarding the attempts at a website redesign, the poor messaging, the smaller programs getting no real attention, etc. 

It’s all very sad when you think about the people with disabilities and illnesses who are ultimately the ones being failed here.

review_title: Not a bad place to start, but definitely not a long-term workplace..
job_title: Junior Data Analyst in Washington, DC
pros: Interview wasn't too hard, location is good, manager is nice, flexible work hours, friendly culture, pay is decent
cons: There's a talent shortage among employees, middle to upper management are pretty bad, lack of tech-savvy employees, projects are all short-term with no prospects..

job_title: Senior Marketing Specialist in Washington, DC
pros: Good work for the most vunerable people in DC.
cons: Started during the pandemic so I am not able to interact with my coworkers face to face.

pros: There are not many good reasons.
cons: The management staff is not knowledgeable. Most have been placed into positions based on family relation and/or other non-credible relationships.

review_title: Run Away As Fast As You Can
pros: Depends on your position but they pay well and have good benefits.
cons: Management is AWFUL. Not only are there too many layers of management but I've never worked in a company where every single person in a supervisory/leadership role is completely incompetent. Not only are the managers incompetent, they are not trustworthy and there is no accountability for their poor performance. Be careful about complaining to HR because they don't work for the employees - they work for management. I saw many colleagues go to HR with legitimate concerns and they were basically told to stop crying about it. Retaliation from managers goes completely unchecked. It's unfortunate because the staff at HSC are really fantastic. The outpatient therapy staff work hard and are highly skilled. If you are motivated and bright therapist, looking to develop your skills as an SLP, OT, PT, or in the field of Psychology - DO NOT WORK HERE. This place will get you no where except hating your life and looking for a new job. HSC Pediatric Center is toxic and it goes all the way up to the CEO.

review_title: Customer Support/System Administrator for 14 years with HSC Health Care System
job_title: Junior Systems Administrator in Washington, DC
pros: The Pros working at HSC Health Care System was the interaction with the staff, co-workers. The feeling of accomplishment after seeing that the hardware, software used by the organization was properly running, and the customers were able to be productive in their assigned areas.
cons: didn't have any CONS about The HSC Health Care System

job_title: Junior Data Analyst in Washington, DC

cons: A little bit disorganized, senior managers aren’t tech savvy, server is unstable, used old technology, system malfunctions a lot

pros: I think the benifits are great. I also think you are exposed to a lot of growth and opportunities at HSC.
